Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.godCards

Class GodCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.godCards.GodCard
Direct Known Subclasses:
OpponentTurnGodCard, WinConditionGodCard, YourBuildGodCard, YourMoveGodCard, YourTurnGodCard
public class GodCard
extends java.lang.Object
Generic Card associated to a god. Every Card has a corresponging json file with all its properties. GodCard manages move and build logic interacting with the IslandBoard gameMap.

  • Method Details

    • startTurn

      public void startTurn()
      Has to be called when the player associated to this card starts his turn. It creates a copy of the states array to consume during the turn.

    • findBuilderPossibleDest

      public java.util.Set<Coordinates> findBuilderPossibleDest​(Builder builder, boolean buildDome)
      Find all possible cells where a builder can move or build
      Parameters:
      builder - Builder we want to use
      buildDome - True if wants to try to build a dome
      Returns:
      A set of available coordinates for moving/building

    • filterNextState

      private void filterNextState()
      This method removes steps that will bring the player into a lose condition. If for example a builder has both option of move and build, but there is a constraint which doesn't allow him to build, the build option will be removed. These control is performer using askMove(int, int, int, int) and askBuild(int, int, int, int, boolean)

    • setGameMap

      public void setGameMap​(IslandBoard gameMap) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Parameters:
      gameMap - every GodCard will be interacting with.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • build

      public boolean build​(int i_src, int j_src, int i_dst, int j_dst, boolean buildDome)
      Method used to actually do a build if askBuild returned a true value, adds a dome or a block based on buildDome parameter
      Parameters:
      buildDome - specifies whether you want to build a dome or not
      Returns:
      True if it was successful (used for test purpose)

    • move

      public boolean move​(int i_src, int j_src, int i_dst, int j_dst)
      Moves a builder owned by godCard's player. It first calls askMove(int, int, int, int) to validate the move and returns if the moved happened
      Returns:
      True if the move did occur.

    • askMove

      public boolean askMove​(int i_src, int j_src, int i_dst, int j_dst)
      Try to move a builder from src position to dst position.
      Parameters:
      i_src - every coordinate must be in range 0 - IslandBoard.dimension (usually 5)
      Returns:
      True if the required move has distance of one, height difference between destination cell and source is less than one and there isn't a dome or an occupant on destination Cell.

    • askBuild

      public boolean askBuild​(int i_src, int j_src, int i_dst, int j_dst, boolean buildDome)
      Tries to build from (i_src, j_src) to (i_dst, j_dst). If flag buildDome is set to true it tries to build a dome instead of a block.
      Parameters:
      buildDome - true if the builder wants to build a dome
      Returns:
      True if the builder can build at (i_dst, j_dst)

    • winCondition

      public boolean winCondition()
      Has to be called after a move(int, int, int, int) or a build(int, int, int, int, boolean).
      Returns:
      True if that event causes the player associated to the godCard to win.

      public java.lang.String getCurrState()
